titleStmt.title: A farewel to Graves-end. Where noble seamen spend their coyn, why should they be abus'd: then let them stay from thence away, where they are strangely us'd. Tune of, Hey boys up go we.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-spur street, without Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "The wanton girls of Graves-end town".
Place and date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Angel in Guilt-spur street, without Newgate
